headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Ends Lower As Traders Slash Rate-Cut Bets; Nvidia Holds To $5 Trillion Mark
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished in the red in Wednesday's mixed close after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said there's no certainty of another 2025 cut in interest rates.  Nvidia, however, held to higher ground in the stock market today, locking its place as Wall Street's first company to close with a $5 trillion valuation.  The chip designer's shares rose ahead of earnings reports from three fellow Magnificent Seven companies.

Nvidia, however, held to higher ground in the stock market today, locking its place as Wall Street's first company to close with a $5 trillion valuation.  The chip designer's shares rose ahead of earnings reports from three fellow Magnificent Seven companies.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Falls As Powell Says December Cut Not Certain; Nvidia Higher (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other stock indexes turned lower Wednesday afternoon as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell cast doubt on whether policymakers are locked in for another rate cut this year after November's reduction.  Stocks were higher after the Fed cut its key rate by 25 basis points but drifted downward during Powell's afternoon press conference.  The Dow fell 0.4% after briefly touching the 48,000 level for the first time.

The Dow fell 0.4% after briefly touching the 48,000 level for the first time.

headline: Verizon Earnings Beat, Revenue Misses. New CEO Promises Big Changes.
summary: Verizon Communications on Wednesday reported third-quarter adjusted earnings that topped Wall Street targets while revenue missed amid its sudden change in chief executives.  Verizon stock rose on the news.  The telecom firm continued to lose wireless subscriber market share amid intensified competition but added more postpaid phone subscribers overall than expected.

raw.headline: Verizon Earnings Beat, Revenue Misses. New CEO Promises Big Changes.
raw.summary: Verizon Communications on Wednesday reported third-quarter adjusted earnings that topped Wall Street targets while revenue missed amid its sudden change in chief executives.  Verizon stock rose on the news.  The telecom firm continued to lose wireless subscriber market share amid intensified competition but added more postpaid phone subscribers overall than expected.

headline: Verizon Stock Jumps Despite Drop in Crucial Phone Subscribers
summary: Verizon Communications lost a net 7,000 postpaid phone connections last quarter, missing expectations that it would add a net 19,000 connections. It is the third consecutive quarter of such losses, though they have been narrowing.

raw.headline: Verizon Stock Jumps Despite Drop in Crucial Phone Subscribers

headline: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Misses Q3 Revenue Estimates
summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025 as sales only rose 1.5% year on year to $33.82 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.21 per share was 1.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Verizon beats estimates for quarterly subscriber additions, profit
summary: Verizon beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and wireless subscriber additions on Wednesday, as promotions around the recent iPhone launches helped the U.S. wireless service provider attract more customers. Shares of the company were up 1% in premarket trading. The company added 44,000 total monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the third quarter, compared with expectations for 19,000 additions, according to data from FactSet.

Shares of the company were up 1% in premarket trading. The company added 44,000 total monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the third quarter, compared with expectations for 19,000 additions, according to data from FactSet.
